unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Allergies by U.S. Region: Determining Degrees of Freedom
question_text: As part of the 2012 National Health Interview Survey, the U.S. Census Bureau collected data from about $73{,}661\text{ children}$ under the age of $18\text{ years}$ . The report provided frequencies of different types of allergies for these children and frequencies were broken down by U.S. region. Data is shown in the table below: No Allergies Hay Fever Respiratory Allergies Food Allergies Skin Allergies Northeast 7,776 1,074 1,108 698 1,321 Midwest 10,966 1,310 1,684 937 1,900 South 16,132 2,621 3,452 1,554 3,476 West 11,413 1,636 1,581 910 2,112 How many degrees of freedom would be used when conducting a ${ \chi }^{ 2 }$ test to see if there is evidence of an association between U.S. region and types of allergies in children under the age of $18$ ?
